intro: Grewia grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved grewia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in spherical heads, and it produces small, fleshy, red fruits that are edible. Grewia grandifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
